sections.title: A calm welcome into Champagne care
sections.copy: Soft-light hero, steady rhythm, and a concise primer on how Champagne care works. This home stack guides visitors to key journeys without heavy motion.

faqs.question: What happens at the first visit?
faqs.answer: We listen to goals, capture scans or photos if helpful, and outline options with straightforward next steps.

faqs.question: Do you show previews before treatment?
faqs.answer: Whenever possible we use visual planning so you can see movement, shaping, or shade shifts before committing.

faqs.question: How do payments work?
faqs.answer: We share estimates early, support staged payments, and provide receipts or documentation you may need.

faqs.answer: We align scans, implant position, and bite data to shape the crown or bridge before milling.

faqs.answer: Yes, we share a visual preview so contours and contacts are clear before the appointment.

faqs.question: What happens on fit day?
faqs.answer: We check comfort, polish margins, and confirm the bite using the digital map.

sections.label: Clinical insight
sections.quote: Composite bonding works best when we honour the natural anatomy – we layer, cure, and polish in stages so the final gloss feels like enamel.

stories.summary: Closed a hairline gap and softened a chipped edge in one appointment.

faqs.question: How long does composite bonding last?
faqs.answer: Most cases stay bright for several years; we monitor and refresh polish during routine hygiene visits.

faqs.question: Is it reversible?
faqs.answer: Bonding is conservative and can be adjusted or removed without harming the underlying enamel.

faqs.question: Will the colour match my teeth?
faqs.answer: We layer resins in shades that mirror your enamel so the finish blends seamlessly.

sections.title: Smile makeovers at St Mary’s House Dental Care
sections.copy:
A “smile makeover” can mean many things — from subtle refinement to more involved restorative work.

At St Mary’s House Dental Care, we use the term in a clinical way: a smile makeover is a thoughtful plan that improves the appearance of your smile without losing sight of health, stability, and long-term maintenance.

There’s no one-size-fits-all smile. Our role is to help you choose what’s sensible, conservative where possible, and predictable over time.
bullets: Thoughtful plan that improves appearance without losing sight of health, stability, and long-term maintenance.
There’s no one-size-fits-all smile.
Choose what’s sensible, conservative where possible, and predictable over time.

sections.label: What a smile makeover can involve
sections.title: What a smile makeover can involve
sections.copy:
A smile makeover may include one or more of the following, depending on what you actually need:
• Whitening to brighten the overall smile
• Composite bonding for conservative shape changes
• Aligners to improve alignment and spacing
• Veneers for carefully selected cases where tooth surface changes are appropriate
• Crowns or restorative dentistry when teeth are heavily restored or structurally compromised
• Implant replacement where teeth are missing and suitability is confirmed

Not every patient needs every option — and not every patient needs treatment at all. Often the best results come from doing less, but doing it well.
sections.mediaHint: What a smile makeover can involve

sections.label: Conservative first, long-term always
sections.title: Conservative first, long-term always
sections.copy:
Cosmetic dentistry is easiest to sell when it’s described as a “quick transformation”. It’s safer — and more honest — to describe it as a set of choices with trade-offs.

We’re comfortable saying no when a request isn’t in a patient’s best interest.

This is the difference between a makeover that looks good in photos and one that remains stable and healthy over time.

items.title: Conservative where possible
items.description: Preserving tooth structure matters.

items.title: Planning-first
items.description: We look at the whole mouth, not just the front teeth.

items.title: Clear about maintenance
items.description: All cosmetic work needs looking after.

sections.label: How we plan your smile makeover
sections.quote:
Every case begins with assessment and listening.

Depending on your needs, planning may include:
• Clinical examination of teeth, gums and bite
• Photographs and digital scans where appropriate
• Discussion of what you like (and don’t like) about your smile
• Explanation of options, limitations, and realistic outcomes
• A staged plan if treatment is better carried out gradually

We focus on clarity: what’s possible, what’s sensible, and what would be better avoided.

A smile makeover isn’t just about the result. It also involves:
• The health of your gums
• How your bite functions
• What can be cleaned and maintained long-term
• Whether treatment is reversible or involves permanent change

We’ll explain these factors clearly, so you can decide with confidence and without pressure.

sections.label: In many cases, small changes can make a meaningful difference.
sections.title: Why patients ask about smile makeovers

stories.summary: Worn or chipped edges; Gaps or uneven spacing.
stories.name: Worn or chipped edges

stories.summary: Crowding or orthodontic relapse; Uneven tooth shape or size.
stories.name: Crowding or orthodontic relapse

stories.summary: Older restorations that show when smiling; A smile that feels tired or dull despite otherwise healthy teeth.
stories.name: Older restorations that show when smiling

faqs.question: Is a smile makeover right for everyone?
faqs.answer: Not necessarily. Suitability depends on oral health, bite, expectations, and long-term maintenance. We confirm this during assessment.

faqs.question: Does a smile makeover always involve veneers?
faqs.answer: No. Many smile improvements can be achieved with whitening, bonding, or orthodontic alignment alone. Veneers are considered only where appropriate.

faqs.question: How long does treatment take?
faqs.answer: Timelines vary depending on the plan. Some cases are completed quickly; others are staged over time for predictability and stability. All dental work has a lifespan and requires maintenance. We’ll explain what to expect and how to look after it long-term.

sections.title: Plan a full smile makeover
sections.strapline: Book a planning session or preview a digital roadmap.

faqs.question: What is The Wand?
faqs.answer: It’s a computer-assisted numbing system that controls flow for gentle delivery.

faqs.question: Does it change the appointment length?
faqs.answer: It’s designed to fit into normal scheduling while keeping the start of treatment comfortable.

faqs.question: Where is it used?
faqs.answer: We use it for treatments that benefit from precise, calm numbing around the area of care.
